articles.title: Kim Jong Un Visits Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Visits Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, gave field guidance to the Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm.
					 When visiting the fruit farm, a patriotic legacy of leader Kim Jong Il, in June last year, he urged it to produce and supply more fruits to the people and thus glorify Kim Jong Il's leadership exploits.
					
					 The supreme leader toured the farm permeated with fruit fragrance, saying that he was so pleased to hear that the farm had an unusually rich harvest of fruit and supplied hundreds of tons of first-harvested apple to the citizens of Pyongyang on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of national liberation.
					
					 Seeing the tempting apples for a while, he said with pleasure it is a sign of prosperity for the country, adding that he is happy to imagine the people being so glad to receive the fruits and that a look at the fruits is enough to make him feel satisfied.
					
					 The Taedonggang Combined Fruit Farm and all other fruit farms across the country should reap a rich harvest every year as this is a very important work for glorifying the undying feats of President Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il for the country's pomiculture and defending their prestige, he stressed.
					
					 He said that the fruit farms should concentrate efforts on raising the per-hectare yield to rapidly increase the country's fruit output.
					
					 In order to develop the pomiculture it is needed to establish the state sci-tech guidance system in a proper way, introduce the advanced technique to keep up with the world trend of fruit culture and conduct a brisk socialist emulation among the fruit farms.
					
					 He gave thanks to the officials and employees of the farm for having reaped a rich harvest of fruits as a present to the 70th anniversary of the Workers' Party of Korea through their devoted efforts to implement the behest of Kim Jong Il.
					
					 He called on them to better the farm into a world-leading thriving orchard for the people with high ambition for world supremacy in the fruit culture and thus convey the great leaders' loving care for the people for all ages.
					
					 Accompanying him were Choe Ryong Hae, O Su Yong and Jo Yong Won.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Jon Mun Jin
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un Sends Wreath to Bier of Jon Mun Jin
						
Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un Tuesday sent a wreath to the bier of Jon Mun Jin, anti-Japanese revolutionary fighter, expressing deep condolences over her death.

articles.title: Senior State Officials Visit Farm No. 1116 under KPA Unit 810
articles.content:
Senior State Officials Visit Farm No. 1116 under KPA Unit 810
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam and other senior state officials, and party and administrative officials of the ministries and national institutions and officials and researchers of the agricultural field visited the Farm No. 1116 under Unit 810 of the Korean People's Army on Monday.
					 Visitors laid bouquets before the monuments to the field-guidance of leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 Being briefed on the leadership exploits of the peerlessly great men, they went round various places including the room for the education in the revolutionary history and fields of "Aegukpul".
					
					 Looking round the bean crops and high-yielding maize species now under cultivation at the farm on an experimental basis and sugar and starch syrup production processes that were built by the efforts and technology of the farm itself, the visitors felt once again that they can bring about a radical turn in improving the people's diet if they make redoubled efforts to carry out the party's policy.

articles.title: Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Ambassador of Netherlands
articles.content:
Credentials to Kim Yong Nam from Ambassador of Netherlands
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, received credentials from Aloysius Johannes Adrianus Embrechts, ambassador of the Netherlands to the DPRK, at the Mansudae Assembly Hall Tuesday.

articles.title: Delegations, Delegates Leave after Participating International Solidarity Event
articles.content:
Delegations, Delegates Leave after Participating International Solidarity Event
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Syrian Arab-Korea Friendship Association, a delegation of the Laos-Korea Friendship Association and a delegation of the Vietnam Union of Friendship Organizations left here for home on Monday and Tuesday after taking part in the international solidarity event for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Also leaving were a Malaysian friendship delegation, a delegation of the IndonesiaÔºçKorea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange, a Mongolian friendship delegation, a delegation of the Korean Friendship Association, a Japanese delegation for celebrating the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, a delegation of the Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK, a secretary of the Nepalese Committee for Promotion of Reunification of Korea and his party, the secretary general of the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea who doubles as chairman of the General Kim Jong Il Peruvian Amicable Institute, the chairman of the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization, the executive secretary of the World Peace Council, the general secretary of the Peace Council of Cyprus and the executive director of the Environmental Education Media Project.

articles.title: Friendship and Solidarity Bodies, International Democratic Bodies Demand Halt to Ulji Freedom Guardian
articles.content:
Friendship and Solidarity Bodies, International Democratic Bodies Demand Halt to Ulji Freedom Guardian
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Organizations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people and international democratic organizations issued a joint statement on August 17 as regards the fact that the U.S. began the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises for aggression once again on behalf of the associations for friendship and solidarity with the Korean people and the international democratic organizations. They included the Afro-Asian People's Solidarity Organization, the Asia-Pacific Regional Committee for Supporting Peaceful Reunification of Korea, the Australia-DPRK Association for Friendship and Culture, the Denmark-DPRK Friendship Association, the Indonesia-Korea Association for Friendship and Cultural Exchange, the Ireland-Korea Friendship Association, the Japan Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, the Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain, the Laos-Korea Friendship Association, the Mongolia-Democ
					 ratic Korea Friendship Bridge Association, the Nepalese Committee for Promotion of Reunification of Korea, the New Zealand-DPRK Society, the Karachi Branch of the Pakistan-Korea Friendship Association, the Peruvian Committee for Supporting the Independent and Peaceful Reunification of Korea, the Philippines Solidarity Committee for Peace and Reunification in the Korean Peninsula, the Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK and Vietnam-DPRK Friendship Association.
					
					 The ceaseless U.S.-south Korea joint military exercises prove that it is none other than the U.S. which brings vicious cycle of confrontation and tension and the danger of war to the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 The statement said:
					
					 The situation on the Korean Peninsula is aggravating day by day. That blame falls on the south Korean authorities pursuing the policy for confrontation with the DPRK for keeping power.
					
					 The south Korean authorities should admit that they drove the north-south relations into an extreme phase through anti-DPRK leaflets operations and "mine explosion" case and staged the joint military exercises with the U.S., leading the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of war, at a time when all the Koreans are grandly celebrating the 70th anniversary of the country's liberation.
					
					 Such unreasonable and dangerous military exercises and smear campaign are denounced and rejected worldwide and should be stopped.
					
					 The statement strongly demanded the U.S. and the south Korean authorities stop at once the joint military exercises for aggression and roll back their policies of inciting hostility and confrontation with the DPRK.

articles.title: DPRK, Russian Governments Sign Protocol of 21st Meeting of Forestry Sub-Committee
articles.content:
DPRK, Russian Governments Sign Protocol of 21st Meeting of Forestry Sub-Committee 
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- A protocol of the 21st meeting of the Forestry Sub-Committee of the Governmental Committee between the DPRK and Russia for the Cooperation of Trade and Economy, Science and Technology was signed here on Tuesday.
					 Present at the signing ceremony were Kim Yong Jin, vice-chairman of the DPRK side to the sub-committee, officials concerned, and members of a delegation of the Russian Forestry Sub-Committee headed by Alexandr Orlov, vice-chairman of the Russian side to the sub-committee.
					
					 Kim Yong Jin and Alexandr Orlov signed the protocol.

articles.title: Indonesian Ambassador Hosts Reception
articles.content:
Indonesian Ambassador Hosts Reception
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Indonesian Ambassador to the DPRK Bambang Hiendrasto hosted a reception at his embassy on Tuesday to mark the 70th anniversary of the independence of Indonesia.
					 Present there on invitation were Yang Hyong Sop, vice-president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Ri Ryong Nam, minister of External Economic Relations, Kim Jong Suk, chairwoman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, Pak Kun Gwang, Ri Kil Song, Son Kwang Ho and other officials concerned, diplomatic envoys, staff members of foreign embassies and representatives of international organizations here.
					
					 On hand were staff members of the Indonesian embassy.
					
					 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Officials, Members of DWUK Start Study Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Officials, Members of DWUK Start Study Tour of Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
						
 Hyesan, August 18 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Democratic Women's Union of Korea (DWUK) across the country started study tour of the revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 A kick-off ceremony took place before the Monument to the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo in Hyesan, Ryanggang Province on Tuesday.
					
					 The participants laid a floral basket and bouquets before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at the monument.
					
					 Kim Myong Ok, vice-chairwoman of the C.C., the union, made a report at the ceremony to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporter and speakers underlined the need to deeply grasp through the study tour the revolutionary feats Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il performed by providing and glorifying forever the revolutionary traditions of Juche.
					
					 They called for learning from the spirit of devotedly defending the leader displayed by the anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters and becoming the ardent women revolutionaries remaining unfailingly loyal to Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 They stressed the need to give fullest play to the high spiritual world and noble traits of the women in the Songun era during the study tour.
					
					 After the ceremony the participants headed for Pochonbo.

articles.title: Officials, Members of UAWK Tour Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
articles.content:
Officials, Members of UAWK Tour Revolutionary Battle Sites in Area of Mt. Paektu
						
 Samjiyon, August 18 (KCNA) -- Officials and members of the Union of Agricultural Workers of Korea (UAWK) across the country made study tour of the revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu from August 10 to 18 on the occasion of the 55th anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il's start of Songun revolutionary leadership.
					 They laid floral baskets and bouquets before the statues of President Kim Il Sung at the Monument to the Victorious Battle of Pochonbo, the Pochonbo Revolutionary Battle Site, the Chongbong Bivouac and the Monument to the Victorious Battle in Musan Area and on the shore of Lake Samji and the mosaic portraying the three commanders of Mt. Paektu in the Paektusan Secret Camp and made bows.
					
					 They went round the command post of the Battle of Pochonbo, the post office, the police post of the Japanese imperialists and other places of the battle site.
					
					 At the Rimyongsu Revolutionary Site, they looked round historic relics, being briefed on how the revolutionary traditions of the Workers' Party of Korea are being steadily inherited.
					
					 They visited the Chongbong and Konchang Bivouacs, groups of subsidiary theme sculptures of the Samjiyon Grand Monument and revolutionary relics on the shore of Lake Samji.
					
					 They visited the Monument to the Victorious Battle in Musan Area and climbed Mt. Paektu.
					
					 At Kim Jong Il's birthplace in the Paektusan Secret Camp, they went round historic relics showing his childhood.
					
					 They held an oath-taking meeting before his old home in the Paektusan Secret Camp.
					
					 They pledged to become fortresses and shields devotedly defending Marshal Kim Jong Un politically and ideologically and at the risk of their lives, while holding Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il as the sun of Juche for all ages.
					
					 During the study tour they conducted a contest of information and agitation of anti-Japanese guerrilla-style, a question-and-answer study contest, a contest of singing revolutionary songs in chorus while marching in array and other political and cultural work.

articles.title: DPRK Sportspersons Meet Kim Kuk Hyang
articles.content:
DPRK Sportspersons Meet Kim Kuk Hyang
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Player Kim Kuk Hyang who won a gold medal at the diving of the 16th FINA World Championships and demonstrated the honor of Songun Korea met sportspersons at the Pyongyang Indoor Stadium on Tuesday.
					 Present there were Kim Yong Hun, minister of Physical Culture and Sports, officials, players, coaches and students in the field of sports in Pyongyang City.
					
					 As Kim Kuk Hyang entered into the place of the meeting, the participants presented her with bouquets and put garlands around her neck.
					
					 People's athlete Kim Kuk Hyang said there that a key to her success was absolutely the leadership of Marshal Kim Jong Un.
					
					 She expressed her resolution to reward the loving care and trust of Kim Jong Un by winning at future international games.
					
					 People's athlete Sin Jong Rim, coach of the April 25 Sports Team, expressed her resolution to devote all her wisdom and enthusiasm to demonstrating the dignity and honor of the great Paektusan nation to the whole world by creating many more sports myths of heroic Korea.
					
					 And speeches were made to renew pledges.
					
					 The speakers warmly congratulated Kim Kuk Hyang once again as she highly demonstrated the dignity and spirit of Kim Il Sung's nation and Kim Jong Il's Korea to the whole world.
					
					 They stressed that they would fully discharge their missions and duties as vanguard fighters in the struggle for building a sports power by winning many more events of the Asian and world championships.

articles.title: Women Football Aces of DPRK
articles.content:
Women Football Aces of DPRK
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The DPRK women's football team recently won the 2015 EAFF East Asian Cup held in Wuhan, China, producing the best player, top scorer and best defender of the tournament.
					 One of them is Ra Un Sim, top scorer of the tournament who was born in Kyongsong County, North Hamgyong Province. She got three goals in the matches against Japanese and south Korean rivals. 
					
					 Wi Jong Sim, who was selected as the best player of the tournament, is active in the Kalmaegi Sports Team. She, born in Sinhung County, South Hamgyong Province, kicked two goals into the net of the Chinese team.
					
					 Kim Nam Hui from the April 25 Sports Team was born in Kim Chaek City, North Hamgyong Province. During the tournament she proved herself worthy of the best defender of the tournament.
					
					 Among women football aces of the DPRK team are Ri Ye Gyong, Hong Myong Hui, Kim Yun Mi, Kim Un Ju and Yun Song Mi.

articles.title: Railway Modernization Brisk in DPRK
articles.content:
Railway Modernization Brisk in DPRK
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Railway modernization has been steadily pushed forward in the DPRK.
					 All the railway workers are fully determined to bring about a fresh turn in improving railways, Kim Sun Ok, a department director of the Ministry of Railways, said.
					
					 She went on:
					
					 When visiting the Kim Jong Thae Electric Locomotive Complex some days ago, supreme leader Kim Jong Un called for modernizing the railways to step up the building of a thriving socialist nation.
					
					 In hearty response to his call, the ministry is concentrating all efforts on developing and producing hi-tech railway transportation means in close cooperation with railway factories and enterprises, while pushing ahead with the projects to put the railway transportation on an IT basis and spruce up railway stations.
					
					 Signal successes have also been made in raising the strength of rails.

articles.title: Antique Clocks Showing Talents of Korean Nation
articles.content:
Antique Clocks Showing Talents of Korean Nation
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Korean people invented different types of clocks long ago.
					 Among them are a sundial called Angbuilgu and clepsydras Jagyokru and Okrugiryun made in the period of the Feudal Joson Dynasty (1392-1910).
					
					 The noontime measured by them exactly coincided with the present one based upon 127 degrees 30 minutes of east longitude.
					
					 Jagyokru was made by engineers including Jang Yong Sil in 1434 and installed in Kyongbok Palace. In the same year, Korean astronomers and engineers manufactured Angbuilgu. 
					
					 Okrugiryun, made in 1438, had played a role of an astronomical instrument.

articles.title: Pyongyang Puppet Company
articles.content:
Pyongyang Puppet Company 
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Puppet shows given by the Pyongyang Puppet Company are enjoying popularity among children in the DPRK.
					 This year alone, the company gave a series of performances at orphanages, kindergartens and primary schools in Pyongyang and Wonsan and at the Songdowon International Children's Camp.
					
					 Its numbers include "Interesting Folk Games", "We Love Our Tune Best", "The Bell Does not Ring", "Ok Soe Destroying Evil" and "Garden Balsam".
					
					 All of them are conducive to improving children's mentality.
					
					 Choe Man Gum, a section chief of the company, told KCNA that the Pyongyang Puppet Company, founded on August 13, Juche 50 (1961), created over 100 puppet plays and gave more than ten thousand performances up till now.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Raps Ulji Freedom Guardian
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Raps Ulji Freedom Guardian
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in an article condemns the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces for opting for staging large-scale Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises despite the strong warnings of the DPRK and unanimous denunciation of the public at home and abroad.
					 The saber-rattling is an unpardonable challenge to the aspiration and demand of the Korean nation and world peace-loving people for detente and peace on the Korean Peninsula and improved north-south relations and an undisguised attempt to ignite a nuclear war against the DPRK, the article says, and goes on:
					
					 The drills are a dangerous nuclear war exercise to unleash a new war.
					
					 The belligerent forces at home and abroad justified the north-targeted war maneuvers, describing them as "regular and open drills" and "transparent and normal exercise". But such sophism can never conceal the danger of the war exercises for aggression.
					
					 We cannot but take a serious note of the fact that the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces are staging the saber-rattling with the south Korea-U.S. combined division and strike means whose operational aim is to "occupy Pyongyang" involved. This proves that the warmongers took off the mask of "annual and defensive drills", bereft of reason, being seized by the hysteria for war against the north.
					
					 It is not exaggeration to say that the north-south relations have, in fact, entered the state of war due to Ulji Freedom Guardian.
					
					 Now is not the 1950s.
					
					 If the U.S. and south Korean puppet forces dare try to test the military muscle of the DPRK, they will meet the end more miserable than what it met in the past Korean war.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun Flays Confrontational Maniac Park Geun Hye
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun Flays Confrontational Maniac Park Geun Hye
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The south Korean chief executive is fanning up the deterioration of north-south relations, wagging her tongue. This is evidenced by the "address for marking August 15" made by Park Geun Hye. What run through her address was embellishing seven decades of sycophancy and fascist dictatorship, shifting the blame for the deteriorated north-south relations on to the DPRK, malignantly slandering the dignity and social system of the DPRK and trumpeting about deceptive "cooperation".
					 Rodong Sinmun Tuesday in a commentary says in this regard:
					
					 In the address Park announced south Korea would stage together with the U.S. the Ulji Freedom Guardian joint military exercises, an open provocation against the DPRK and undisguised declaration for confrontation with it.
					
					 How will separated families and their relatives be able to meet one another with the war maneuvers being staged and how will the "peace park" be built in the atmosphere of confrontation with compatriots?
					
					 If the north-targeted joint war maneuvers are stopped and an atmosphere of reconciliation and unity between the north and the south is created, separated families and their relatives will be able to meet at the famous mountain of the nation.
					
					 Park had better do what she has to do, not pulling up the north. She would be well advised to bear in mind that her tongue-wagging would bring deeper abyss of ruin.

articles.title: Minju Joson Accuses Japanese Reactionaries of Challenging Demand of International Community
articles.content:
Minju Joson Accuses Japanese Reactionaries of Challenging Demand of International Community
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- In the Japanese prime minister's recent "statement to mark the 70th anniversary of the end of WWII" published on the 70th anniversary of Japan's defeat, Japan did not make honest admission and apology for its history of aggression.
					 Commenting on this, Minju Joson Tuesday says this has touched off denunciation and resentment of the broad international community.
					
					 It is because Japan is blatantly challenging the demand of the international community for its past liquidation, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are ignoring the heinous crimes against humanity committed by the Japanese imperialists in the past because they are trying to embellish the history of overseas wars of aggression and instill pride of it into the rising generations in a bid to hurl them to conquering other nations in the future.
					
					 To this end, they are unhesitatingly distorting and rewriting history textbooks and visiting Yasukuni Shrine.
					
					 It is as clear as noonday that in case the militarily expanded Japan gains the right to participate in war, it would reinvade Asia as it has no guilty conscience on the history of overseas aggression.
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries had better bear in mind that revival of militarism and policy for overseas expansion would not bring a bright future to Japan.
					
					 The way-out and future of Japan lie in making apology and reparation for the past crimes, getting reconciled with the Asian countries and opting for the road of peace.
					
					 Japan should recollect the history of the past crimes, seriously repent of itself and get itself ready to turn over a new leaf with the 70th anniversary of its defeat as a momentum.

articles.title: Japan's Future Is Gloomy: KCNA Commentary
articles.content:
Japan's Future Is Gloomy: KCNA Commentary
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- After the "statement to mark the 70th anniversary of the end of WWII" by Japanese Prime Minister Abe was published, the world understanding of Japan has become worse.
					 The international community has long paid attention to his statement to be published to mark the 70th anniversary of the end of World War II hoping that Japan would sincerely apologize to the peoples of the victimized states and clearly part from the history of militarist aggression.
					
					 But his statement for which the world has so far shown concern made no mention of honest admission and apology for Japan's history of aggression. So, the Japanese people and the international community unanimously estimated that the statement made a big retreat in the understanding of history from the one made by the then Japanese Prime Minister Tomiichi Murayama in August 1995 marking 50 years since Japan's defeat in the war.
					
					 In the past century Japan ran amuck for the aggression war with the wild ambition of the "Greater East Asia Co-Prosperity Sphere" and inflicted great disasters on the peoples of different countries in Asia and the world only to fall into a deep abyss of ruin to the end.
					
					 In particular, Japan's aggression of Korea and colonial rule over it that lasted at least four decades were unprecedentedly atrocious and brutal.
					
					 During occupation of Korea the Japanese imperialists massacred more than one million innocent Koreans, forced murderous slave labour after forcibly drafting over 8.4 million people and made 200 000 women sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 Nevertheless, Abe cried out for sort of future and responsibility and contribution to the international community with ambiguous phrases of reflection and apology, not mentioning any word of apology and reflection on the hair-raising crimes and unspeakable damage done by Japan against Korean and other Asian people.
					
					 Abe let loose a string of shameless remarks that women's honor was defamed due to war, not mentioning the atrocities committed by the Japanese imperialists, the unprecedented crimes such as the forcible drafting of many Korean women for the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army. He went the lengths of blaring that posterity having nothing to do with war should not be made to continue to make apology as the number of those who were born after the war make up the overwhelming majority of the population. 
					
					 Japan's past liquidation is an urgent matter good for itself rather than for others.
					
					 That is why many Japanese with a proper thinking faculty about Japan's future have asserted that the government should make a bold decision for the past liquidation at an early date.
					
					 67 percent of the respondents polled recently by the Kyodo News answered that the chief executive should include an expression of apology for the colonial rule and aggression in his "statement to mark the 70th anniversary of the end of WWII", a reflection of the Japanese people's mindset.
					
					 In a press conference as regards Abe's statement, Murayama charged that his sentences failed to give impression that Japan honestly apologized for its colonial rule and aggression which were very bad.
					
					 The chairman of the International Relations Committee of the U.S. House of Representatives in a statement said it is very regretful that Abe neither apologized to the victims of Korea and neighboring countries nor made any mention of crimes related to the sexual slavery. Michael Honda, a member of the U.S. House of Representatives said Abe's statement is an insult to the victims of the "comfort women" for the Imperial Japanese Army.
					
					 BBC of Britain and media of France and Germany said that Abe did not make direct and official apology.
					
					 All facts prove that the ruling forces of Japan are blatantly challenging the international community demanding its past liquidation, far from reflecting on the history of aggression on the 70th anniversary of the defeat of the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 If this is a true picture of Japan, its future is gloomy, indeed.

articles.title: Ulji Freedom Guardian Kicked off in S. Korea
articles.content:
Ulji Freedom Guardian Kicked off in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean bellicose forces kicked off joint military exercise Ulji Freedom Guardian, a rehearsal for a nuclear war against the DPRK, on Monday despite the strong protest and condemnation at home and abroad, according to KBS of south Korea.
					 The south Korean warmongers called the joint military drill being staged every year "command post exercise of defensive nature to check the posture of joint defense" with the U.S. in case of contingency on the Korean peninsula.
					
					 However, it is clear to everyone that the military exercise is an unpardonable nuclear war rehearsal against the DPRK in open violation of the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK.
					
					 The exercise activated the military means for aggression whose operation mission was to "eliminate the headquarters and occupy Pyongyang" and is aimed at a surprise preemptive attack on the DPRK with the operational command posts in place.
					
					 The situation on the Korean peninsula is inching close to the brink of war due to the saber rattling against the DPRK with the involvement of tens of thousands of U.S. aggression troops and south Korean puppet forces against the world people and Korean people's ever-increasing demand for the detente and reunification of the peninsula.
					
					 The reality shows the U.S. and south Korean warmongers are wreckers of peace and aggression forces obsessed with confrontation and war.

articles.title: Large-scale Actions against U.S., Japan Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Large-scale Actions against U.S., Japan Staged in S. Korea
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- People from all walks of life in south Korea held a large-scale rally and demonstration in Seoul on August 15, the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation, according to Voice of People, an internet paper of south Korea.
					 There took place the August 15 rally for national reunification at the university street in Jongro District.
					
					 Speakers accused the Park Geun Hye regime of following the U.S. moves to rearm Japan, resorting to the hostile policy toward the north and going against the people's desire for peaceful reunification, far from refusing the shackling alliance with the U.S. and improving south-north relations.
					
					 Then the August 15 all-people rally for peace against war was held with more than 10 000 people of all social strata including those from at least 40 civic and public organizations attending.
					
					 At the end of the rally there took place a demonstration.
					
					 After the demonstration the participants held a rally once again in Jongro District and tore down the disgusting Stars and Stripes and a flag symbolic of Japanese militarism.

articles.title: S. Korean Paper Accuses Puppet Forces of Their Deceptive Ballad of Dialogue
articles.content:
S. Korean Paper Accuses Puppet Forces of Their Deceptive Ballad of Dialogue
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- An editorial accusing the south Korean puppet forces of their deceptive ballad of dialogue was posted on the south Korean internet paper Voice of People on August 11.
					 The editorial recalled that at the meeting of chief secretaries of Chongwadae on August 10, Park Geun Hye claimed that there created a condition for operating again the "labor-business-government committee", threatening the labor circle to opt for dialogue.
					
					 This is a pressure that the labor circle opposing the "government's" retrogressive revision of labor should join in its "labor reform", the editorial said.
					
					 The statement to the people made by Park on August 6 is, in fact, a declaration of war against the labor circle.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Denounces U.S. Forces for Their Anthrax Germ Experiments
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Denounces U.S. Forces for Their Anthrax Germ Experiments
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The People's Action for Peace against War of south Korea held a rally in Ryongsan, Seoul on August 15 and denounced the U.S. imperialist aggressor forces in south Korea for their anthrax germ experiments.
					 Speakers said the U.S. forces threw away poisonous substances into the River Han from their base in Ryongsan, conducted anthrax germ experiments and committed many other crimes.
					
					 They called for fighting it out to have the U.S. forces withdrawn from south Korea and achieve peace and reunification on the Korean Peninsula.
					
					 Then they marched as far as the U.S. 8th Corps Command.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Censures Japanese Authorities for Embellishing War Crimes and Denying History
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Censures Japanese Authorities for Embellishing War Crimes and Denying History
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Council for the Solution of the Issue of the Volunteers Corps in south Korea released an article on August 14 in denunciation of the shameless attitude of the Japanese authorities denying the past crimes till now, 70 years since Japan's defeat.
					 The article accused Japanese Prime Minister Abe for avoiding the blame of the Japanese government for the past crimes at his statement published on the 70th anniversary of Japan's defeat.
					
					 Abe did not refer to the illegal colonial rule over Korea but made an excuse that Japan was compelled to take the road of war, sparking off astonishment, the article charged.
					
					 The Japanese government is not entitled to talk about peace any longer as it has no willingness to make victims of sexual slavery stop weeping, it stressed.

articles.title: S. Korean Body Demands Halt to Psychological Broadcasting Warfare
articles.content:
S. Korean Body Demands Halt to Psychological Broadcasting Warfare
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The People for Achieving Peace and Reunification in south Korea held a press conference outside the puppet Ministry of Defense on August 11 demanding a halt to the broadcasting for psychological warfare which will bring dangerous military conflict.
					 It said that the ministry branded the "mine explosion" case that occurred on August 4 as the "north's deed", resumed the broadcasting for "psychological warfare against the north" and intensified military operations in the Demilitarized Zone along the Military Demarcation Line.
					
					 It held that the military authorities did not advance clear evidence that can prove the "mine explosion" as the "north's deed".
					
					 It strongly demanded an immediate stop to the broadcasting for psychological warfare escalating military confrontation and tension and bedeviling the south-north relations.

articles.title: S. Korean Students Condemn Japan's Past Crimes
articles.content:
S. Korean Students Condemn Japan's Past Crimes
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- There took place rallies and demonstrations of south Korean students outside the Japanese embassy in Seoul on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation. They condemned Japan's past crimes and demanded its apology and reparation.
					 Students held a rally there on August 15.
					
					 Speakers denounced the Japanese prime minister's "statement to mark the 70th anniversary of the end of WWII" as it mentioned no apology for the crimes of aggression and Japan's moves for rearmament.
					
					 They said Japan should make sincere apology to the Korean nation and make sincere efforts for the past liquidation.
					
					 A students' declaration on national independence was read out at the rally.
					
					 Meanwhile, the south Korean Buddhist Youth Society held a press conference there on the same day.
					
					 Students of high schools and universities also held anti-Japanese rallies and demonstrations there on August 14 and 15.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Message Posted on Nigerian Website
articles.content:
Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Message Posted on Nigerian Website
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's message of congratulations to the women football players who won the title of the 2015 EAFF Women's East Asian Cup was posted on the website of the Nigerian National Committee for the Study of Kimilsungism-Kimjongilism on Aug. 11.

articles.title: 70th Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Celebrated in Russia
articles.content:
70th Anniversary of Korea's Liberation Celebrated in Russia
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- There took place a meeting in Russia on Aug. 11 to mark the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Displayed at the venue of the meeting were works of President Kim Il Sung, leader Kim Jong Il and Marshal Kim Jong Un and books introducing Songun Korea.
					
					 Present at the meeting were V. A. Petrov, chairman of the Russian Association for Friendship and Cultural Cooperation with the DPRK who doubles as chairman of the Russian preparatory committee for celebrating the 70th anniversaries of the founding of the Workers' Party of Korea and the liberation of Korea, other Russian public figures and masses.
					
					 Invited there were the DPRK ambassador and staff members of his embassy in Moscow.
					
					 The reporter and speakers referred to the fact that the President led the Korean people's heroic struggle against the Japanese imperialists and liberated Korea.
					
					 Friendship between the peoples of both countries was forged and deepened to be unbreakable through the joint struggle against imperialism, they noted.
					
					 They praised the Korean people for building an invincible socialist power prospering despite the imperialists' harassment under the leadership of the President and Kim Jong Il. 
					
					 The people of the DPRK kept dynamically advancing along the road of independence of their own choice full of confidence and optimism under the guidance of Kim Jong Un, they said, adding that the Russian friends sincerely hoped for successes in the friendly DPRK in the future too. 
					
					 A congratulatory message to Kim Jong Un was adopted at the meeting.

articles.title: Foreign Media Report on Korea's Reunification
articles.content:
Foreign Media Report on Korea's Reunification
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Newspapers and radios of Cambodia and Myanmar reported on the issue of Korea's independent and peaceful reunification from July 27 to Aug. 10 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 A Cambodian paper said supreme leader Kim Jong Un set forth a task of opening up a broad avenue to independent reunification in the year marking the 70th anniversary of national liberation by the joint efforts of the whole nation in his New Year Address. The paper elaborated the task and heartily hoped for a turning point in Korea's reunification this year.
					
					 F.M. 90.5 Radio and Apsara Television and Radio of Cambodia aired the similar report.
					
					 The Myanmar paper The New Age said it was a tragedy that a homogenous nation of the same blood which lived in one territory with the same cultural tradition for 5 000 years suffered from a division in the contemporary times. 
					
					 Elaborating the U.S. desperate disturbances of reunification of the Korean peninsula for the past decades, the paper went on:
					
					 70 year-long division of Korea proved that the Korean people's efforts for reunification failed to yield desired results due to the U.S. interference.
					
					 The issue of Korea's reunification is not confined only to the Korean peninsula but is directly related with the global peace and security.
					
					 Korea should be reunified peacefully as soon as possible for the peace and security of the world.
					
					 The U.S. should stop the moves to obstruct the reunification of Korea.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Liberating Country Praised by Myanmar Figures
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits for Liberating Country Praised by Myanmar Figures
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- Myanmar figures made public statements on Aug. 10 on the occasion of the 70th anniversary of Korea's liberation.
					 Tha Win, secretary of the Yangon Regional Committee of the Union Solidarity and Development Party of Myanmar, said:
					
					 President Kim Il Sung organized and led twenty years of the hard-fought anti-Japanese revolutionary struggle to victory and thus liberated the country.
					
					 He covered the road for the country and people all his life since he embarked upon the road of the revolution in his teens and performed the undying feats before the history of the revolutionary struggle of the Korean people and world history of politics.
					
					 The Korean people will achieve a brilliant victory in their struggle for building a thriving nation and accomplishing the cause of reunifying the country as they are led by H.E. Kim Jong Un, supreme leader of the DPRK.
					
					 Tin Tun, director of the Myanmar Medical Research Institute, said:
					
					 Aug. 15 is a meaningful day for the Korean people as it gave the joy of national rebirth and made them be the genuine masters of the country.
					
					 Kim Il Sung led the bloody anti-Japanese war to victory and thus retook the usurped country and highly demonstrated the national dignity.
					
					 Kim Jong Un who carries forward the idea and cause of Kim Il Sung and leader Kim Jong Il is now wisely guiding the overall work of the party and state and making efforts for defending the country's sovereignty and dignity and building an economic power.

articles.title: Works and Brief Biographies of DPRK's Great Leaders Posted on Internet
articles.content:
Works and Brief Biographies of DPRK's Great Leaders Posted on Internet
						
 Pyongyang, August 18 (KCNA) -- The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain posted the full texts of President Kim Il Sung's work "Let the North and the South Open the Way to Peace and the Reunification of the Country in a United Effort", leader Kim Jong Il's work "Let Us Carry Out the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung's Instructions for National Reunification" and Marshal Kim Jong Un's work "Let Us March Forward Dynamically towards Final Victory, Holding Higher the Banner of Songun" on its website on Aug. 10. 
					 The website carried their brief biographies with portraits of smiling Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il and a photo of Kim Jong Un.

Kim Jong Un's Congratulatory Message Posted on Website of DR Congo
						
 Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Supreme leader Kim Jong Un's message of congratulations to the women football players who won the title of the 2015 EAFF Women's East Asian Cup was posted on the website of the National Committee of DR Congo for the Study of the Juche Idea on August 10.

articles.title: Kim Jong Un envia ofrenda floral ante feretro de la difunta Jon Mun Jin
articles.content:
National Exhibition of Achievements of Young Scientists and Technicians Held
						
 Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A national exhibition of achievements of young scientists and technicians was held here from Aug. 12 to 19 on the occasion of the Youth Day.
					 Displayed there were more than 3 740 valuable inventions and new technical innovation proposals.
					
					 During the exhibition the participants introduced their scientific and technical achievements and exchanged experience. 
					
					 A closing ceremony took place at the Three-Revolution Exhibition House on Wednesday.
					
					 Ri Song Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the youth league, made a closing address.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam recibe cartas credenciales de embajador holandes
articles.content:
Congratulations to Minister of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation of Congo 
						
 Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- Foreign Minister of the DPRK Ri Su Yong on Aug. 12 sent a congratulatory message to Gakosso Jean Claude upon his appointment as minister of Foreign Affairs and Cooperation of Congo. 
					 In the message Ri Su Yong expressed the will to make all efforts to boost the bilateral relations together with Gakosso Jean Claude who has shown deep concern for developing friendship and cooperation between the two countries in various fields and wished him big success in his new job.

articles.title: Firmado protocolo de XXI reunion de subcomision de selvicultura de Comision Intergubernamental Corea-Rusia
articles.content:
DPRK History Society Discloses Japan's Crime Related to Ulmi Incident of 1895
						
 Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- The History Society of the DPRK Wednesday released a memorandum denouncing the Japanese reactionaries  for trying to cover up the despicable crime of the Ulmi Incident of 1895 committed by the Japanese militarists and to evade the responsibility for it. 
					 Branding the Ulmi incident in which the Japanese militarists killed the Empress Myongsong in a brutal and cruel way as a hideous crime gravely violating the sovereignty of the Korean people, the memorandum went on:
					
					 At the time of the incident Korea was on the decline owing to the evermore intensified moves of the capitalist powers for aggression and the incompetent rule by the feudal ruling quarters. However, Korea was still maintaining its status as an independent state and exercising its sovereignty. 
					
					 As for Empress Myongsong, she was the then representative of the state power who was taking the helm of state affairs representing Emperor Kojong. 
					
					 The Japanese militarists stormed the imperial palace of an independent and sovereign state and cruelly murdered the Empress. This was a hideous crime against humanity as it was wanton violation of sovereignty of Korea and an intolerable infringement upon the dignity of the Korean people. 
					
					 By committing the Ulmi incident in breach of the basic principles of international law, the Japanese militarists sought to turn Korea into its exclusive colony.
					
					 The Ulmi incident was the state-sponsored terrorist crime committed by the then Japanese government. It was proved by all facts including the purpose of the incident, how it was carried out and disposal of the aftermath. 
					
					 The purpose was to block Czarist Russia's expansion of power toward Korea and realize the ambition for unchallenged domination. 
					
					 To this end, Japan tried to remove Empress Myongsong, head of pro-Russian group, to easily realize the ambition for aggression. 
					
					 After finding the murder of Empress Myongsong as the best way for changing the Korean feudal government's pro-Russia policy into the pro-Japanese policy the Japanese militarists planned to assassinate the Empress by the use of pro-Japanese element Pak Yong Hyo, the then minister of internal affairs of the Korean feudal government, through Japanese minister resident to Korea Inoue. 
					
					 Shocked by the failure of assassinating the empress, the Japanese government directly worked out a plot to kill the Empress in a bid to turn in its favor the policy for aggression of Korea that faced the crisis of total destruction. 
					
					 The whole process in which the Empress was murdered by Miura-led Japanese murderers fully proved that the Ulmi incident was cooked up by the Japanese government. It was also proved by what Japan did later to deal with the aftermath of the incident. 
					
					 The Ulmi incident was the brigandish crime showing brutality and shamelessness of the Japanese militarists. 
					
					 The murder of the Empress was the most brutal and monstrous one unprecedented in the history of the world. 
					
					 Its brutality and cruelty were proved by the eyewitnesses and testimonies of people in different countries who investigated the fact later. 
					
					 The then Japanese militarists also admitted its brutality and cruelty. 
					
					 The shamelessness of the Japanese militarists was fully revealed by the cunning moves they resorted to cover up the truth of the Ulmi incident and shift the blame for the incident on to Koreans. 
					
					 Nevertheless, the Japanese militarists tried to distort the fact to give impression that it had nothing to do with them under the foolish calculation to evade the responsibility for the crime. 
					
					 Later the Japanese militarists obtained the exclusive possession of all the historical materials of the Korean feudal government and removed all the records related to the killing of Empress Myongsong so that they would not be an object of future controversies as far as the responsibility for the incident was concerned. 
					
					 However, no fraud can cover up the historical truth. 
					
					 The Korean people will never forget the crime related to the Ulmi incident committed by the Japanese militarists but force Japan to make an apology without fail.

articles.title: Miembros de UTAC recorren campos de batalla revolucionaria del Paektu
articles.content:
Spokesman for DPRK NDC Warns Abe Group Not to Run Wild for Revival of Militarism
 Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the National Defence Commission (NDC) of the DPRK Wednesday released a statement as regards the "statement to mark the 70th anniversary of the end of WWII" made by Japanese Prime Minister Abe on August 14.
					 Abe's "statement" on the 70th anniversary of the Japanese imperialists' defeat in the war should have been full of deep remorse and heartfelt apology for the bloody crime-woven past which inflicted tremendous damage and sufferings on the Korean and other Asian peoples, the statement said, and went on:
					
					 No sooner had Abe's "statement" been published than it aroused hatred and resentment of public at home and abroad.
					
					 Abe's "statement" is a blatant challenge to the sovereignty and dignity of the DPRK, international justice and conscience of mankind as it concealed, curtailed and avoided the crimes from the beginning to the last.
					
					 Abe is a typical man of modern samurais who carried forward craftiness and belligerency and is accustomed to ultra-right reactionary idea as he is running the whole gamut of gimmick to bury the unprecedented hair-raising crimes into the oblivion of history.
					
					 Looking back on the past, what Abe buckled down to right after he became the driver of a militarist chariot running headlong into the road of reinvasion was to revise the constitution in order to totally deny the legal position of Japan as a war criminal state and defeated state which is unable to make any military threat or use and have army after the Second World War.
					
					 The army and people of the DPRK will certainly and unconditionally force the Japanese reactionaries, the sworn enemy, to pay thousand-fold price generation after generation.
					
					 If Abe does not want to face nightmare-like tragedy on this planet, he should bring his knees before the Korean people and mankind, unconditionally apologize for the unheard-of crimes and make honest reparation for them, showing his will in practice to prevent Japan from repeating the crime-woven past. 
					
					 This is the best way for saving Japan from running fast to ruin.

articles.title: Miembros de UMDC comienzan marcha por lugares de batalla revolucionaria del Paektu
articles.content:
Park Geun Hye Should Be Buried in Cemetery as Soon as Possible: Spokesman for DPRK Organization
						
 Pyongyang, August 19 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Joint National Organization of Working People issued a statement on Wednesday denouncing Park Geun Hye, a trouble-maker of the nation, for spitting out venoms in her "address marking August 15".
					 She said in an address the north must follow the change of the international community, the statement noted, and went on:
					
					 What she uttered is nothing but sophism of a person without elementary faculty of judging her fellow countrymen.
					
					 What should be changed is none other than south Korea, a colony of the U.S. as it has to serve and follow the U.S. whether it likes or not, and Park Geun Hye as she is steeped in confrontation with fellow countrymen to the marrow of her bones.
					
					 What all the Koreans want and expect is to wipe out sycophants and traitors such as Park from the members of the nation to the last one.
					
					 Park also cried out for "purge". Purge is an essential means for the puppet forces to prop up their regime as they resort to repression and bestial suppression.
					
					 Park grumbled that the north is "wrecking peace and going against south-north integration" while not responding to the "proposal for dialogue".
					
					 If she had been sincere in her proposal for dialogue, she would have buckled down to creating an atmosphere for it.
					
					 From the outset of the year, Park and her group, however, have escalated confrontation totally going against the resumption of dialogue.
					
					 This time, she trumpeted about the inviolable nuclear issue of the DPRK once again. Not only all the Koreans but the world public regards the DPRK's nuclear deterrence as a treasured sword for protecting the peace of the country and security of the nation.
					
					 Only Park is denying this universally accepted truth.
					
					 She vociferated about the trite "north's deed" peppered with intrigues and fabrications. She unhesitatingly said that the north is "threatening security" through "cyber attack".
					
					 She wagged her venomous tongue to let loose a spate of invectives such as "provocation and threat" and to say the north will "invite isolation and ruin by itself".
					
					 It is Park who does not know even the conception of provocation and threat.
					
					 Though belatedly, she should study the conceptions of provocation and threat and acknowledge herself to have been a chieftain committing provocation and threat on this land.
					
					 She talked rubbish that "an opportunity is being given now", trumpeting about the July 4 joint statement.
					
					 We would like to ask Park who dared talk about the July 4 joint statement.
					
					 Does she sympathize with the principle of independence that calls for settling all the issues arising between the north and the south, large and small, from the stand of attaching importance and giving priority to the nation without dependence on foreign forces and free from their interference?
					
					 Does she approve the principle of peaceful reunification that reflects the patriotic spirit of protecting the living place of fellow countrymen from war disaster and guaranteeing the co-prosperity of the nation?
					
					 Has she willingness to accept the spirit of By Our Nation Itself and the principle of great national unity, which is the nation's mode of existence the key point of which is that division leads to ruin and reunification to powerful nation, and engine of improving north-south relations?
					
					 If she stands before the solemn questions of all Koreans, she will get ablush as she has so far become all the more hysteric going against all of them.
					
					 Resentful is that she talked crafty venoms as if she were interested in settling the issue of "separated families" which had already gone bankrupt. Lurking behind this is her ill purpose to calm down the people's mindset against her self-opinionated and shameless unpopular rule.
					
					 This time, she talked nonsense that she would create "world ecology peace park" in the Demilitarized Zone to make it a "new axis for realizing cooperation".
					
					 Nonsensical is her call for creating the "peace park" in the biggest hotspot in the world, where the worst confrontation persists and a war may break out any moment.
					
					 She also made all kinds of spurious remarks.
					
					 Explicitly speaking once again, she should set right the bad situation in south Korea before caring for and discussing the life of someone.
					
					 No matter how glittering make-up she may put, it is too late to prevent the foul smell from reeking off from her body interwoven with sycophancy, treachery, confrontation and hostility.
					
					 What she should do for the nation is to leave Chongwadae, the doghouse of the U.S., shut her unshapely mouth and get her crime-ridden body buried in the ceremony at an early date.
